intro: Polyspora tonkinensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese star vine, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces white or pale yellow flowers that are often fragrant, and its fruits are small berries that turn red when mature. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
